summary: The Choice Arrangement Act of 2025 amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide for the treatment of employer-provided health reimbursement arrangements (HRAs) integrated with individual market coverage. It defines and regulates "custom health option and individual care expense arrangements" (CHOICE arrangements), including nondiscrimination, substantiation, and notice requirements. The bill also provides an employer credit for establishing CHOICE arrangements, allows participants to purchase exchange insurance, and mandates the inclusion of permitted benefits on W-2 forms. The amendments are effective for plan years beginning after December 31, 2025.
